intro: Hieracium coloratipes, commonly known as the colorful hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its bright yellow or orange flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the leaves are lance-shaped with rough textures. Hieracium coloratipes is often found in temperate climates and can sometimes be invasive in non-native regions.
